summary: Valentine-themed modern interactive website where the user is led through an epilogue prompt ("Do you wanna know a secret") into the main question ("Will you be my valentine Akriti?") with Yes/No options where No keeps looping/escalating with teasing prompts until Yes; Yes triggers a customized sweet success message ("My cute little baby" + specified body copy) with celebratory animations and cute emotes.
architectural_notes: Yes success state copy is explicitly user-defined: header "My cute little baby" plus two provided body paragraphs; include cute emotes/design accents and additional animations.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page Valentine-themed modern landing experience that prominently asks the user: "Will you be my valentine?" and presents two choices ("Yes" and "No") with a cute, lovely, and beautiful overall aesthetic.

Implement a playful "Yes is inevitable" interaction for the "No" option that prevents a successful "No" selection while remaining fun and non-broken (e.g., the "No" button dodges the cursor/tap, moves to random safe positions within the viewport, changes microcopy, or becomes increasingly hard to click).

When the user selects "Yes", show an exciting celebratory moment and a clear success state (e.g., heart/confetti animation, a cute confirmation message, and an option to replay/ask again). Keep all user-facing text in English.

Apply a coherent visual theme across the page (colors, typography, spacing, components, and motion) with a distinct modern-romantic style (e.g., warm pinks/reds, cream neutrals, soft gradients, subtle sparkles, rounded cards) and consistent UI patterns.

Add required static visual assets (generated images) to support the Valentine look (background/illustration), store them under frontend/public/assets/generated, and render them in the UI without routing images through the backend.

Expand the "No" button behavior so that it includes at least 10 distinct, fun, escalating interaction patterns across successive user attempts (hover, touch, and click), while still preventing a successful "No" selection and keeping the app feeling responsive and non-broken.

Update the "No"-attempt feedback copy shown under the question to continue reacting beyond 5 attempts (keeping all user-facing text in English), so the escalating "No" interactions feel acknowledged by the page.

Ensure the expanded "No" interactions respect reduced-motion preferences: when the user prefers reduced motion, use non-motion alternatives (e.g., label/microcopy changes, subtle style changes) rather than fast/large movement animations.
Add an epilogue step before the Valentine question that displays the prompt "Do you wanna know a secret" and a single affirmative action that advances into the main Valentine question flow.
Personalize the main question headline to exactly: "Will you be my valentine Akriti?" and ensure all related user-facing strings remain in English.

Adjust the 'No' path so that after each 'No' attempt the interface continues to present the user with the choice again in a loop ("No" is never a terminal outcome), and add more interesting/escalating on-screen prompts that actively steer the user toward choosing "Yes".

Make the "Yes" success state message significantly sweeter, more loving, and more emotionally expressive (English), and increase the celebratory feel beyond the current baseline (while respecting reduced-motion preferences).

Increase overall UI animation/interactivity in the epilogue and question views to feel more fun and lively while keeping the existing cute/romantic aesthetic and maintaining accessibility (including reduced-motion behavior).

Update the 'Yes' success-state content (the card shown after the celebration overlay) to use the exact user-provided copy, including a new header and two body paragraphs, and enhance the typography/layout to feel like a romantic love note while keeping all user-facing text in English.

Ensure the 'No' path is a persistent loop: the user can keep attempting to choose "No" indefinitely and is repeatedly presented with the option again ("No" is never a terminal outcome). Each attempt should show an escalating sequence of teasing prompts so the user feels 'bombarded' playfully, while still keeping the app responsive and not broken.

Add more animation and cute emotes/design accents throughout the question and success views (e.g., additional heart/sparkle accents, micro-interactions on buttons and headings), while respecting reduced-motion preferences by providing non-motion alternatives (subtle style changes, static accents) when motion is reduced.

new_feature_requests.summary: Design a modern Valentine-themed landing page that asks "Will you be my valentine?" with Yes/No choices where Yes is inevitable (playful interaction) and an overall cute/lovely aesthetic.
Expand the "No" button behavior to include at least 10 fun escalating interactive interactions (e.g., dodging, moving, changing text/size/position) to nudge the user toward choosing "Yes".
Add an epilogue step before the main question: show "Do you wanna know a secret" with a Yes action that advances to the Valentine question.
After the user selects "No", keep presenting "No" repeatedly in a loop with interesting/escalating prompts to steer them toward choosing "Yes" (No never final).
Personalize the main prompt text to: "Will you be my valentine Akriti?"
Make the "Yes" success state message more sweet, loving, and emotionally expressive (in English), with enhanced celebratory feel.
Increase overall UI animation/interactivity to make the interface more fun and lively (while staying cute/romantic).
Update the "Yes" success state content to use the exact requested copy: header "My cute little baby" and the two provided body paragraphs, and enhance it with necessary cute emotes/design elements.

projectName: Valentine-themed playful landing page with inevitable “Yes” interaction
